title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1211.35 - Corrosive liquids referenced to this section
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1211.35 - Corrosive liquids referenced to this section

State Regulations

Corrosive liquids listed in section
1211.150
for reference to this
section are restricted to a maximum quantity per vehicle of 60 gallons or 1000
pounds gross weight provided, however, the contents of each container is 15
gallons capacity or less. (b) When it
is known that said article contains less than 10 percent free mineral acid, or
free caustic, or other liquids having similar effect and the shipping paper is
noted accordingly, it is allowed passage without quantity restriction when the
container size is 16 ounces or less, otherwise, the quantity is not to exceed
5000 pounds gross weight per vehicle, regardless of the size of container, or
not to exceed 2500 pounds net weight in a tank vehicle. (c) There are no restrictions on the passage
of empty tank vehicles [FN*] or the transport of empty containers which last
contained such corrosive liquid provided the accompanying shipping papers show
them to be empty. [FN*] A tank vehicle which has been drained of the
material it contained, with residue not in excess of 15
gallons. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
1211.35

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
